conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The image shows four inlets labeled A, B, C, and D at the top of the setup.
There are multiple ramps and barriers in the setup, including orange, black, red, yellow, purple, and pink bars.
There are two containers at the bottom labeled E (blue) and F (yellow).

premise: Stream A meets the long orange bar (upper left).
conclusion: The orange bar sends stream A down-and-right.

premise: Stream A flows down-and-right and meets the long black bar.
conclusion: The black bar tips stream A straight down just inside the blue mouth.

premise: Stream A flows straight down into the blue mouth.
conclusion: Stream A ends in container E.

premise: Stream B meets the same orange bar but a little farther to the right.
conclusion: The orange bar sends stream B down-and-right.

premise: Stream B flows down-and-right and arrives still high enough to hit the red bar.
conclusion: The red bar deflects stream B leftward so that it drops into the blue mouth.

premise: Stream B drops into the blue mouth.
conclusion: Stream B ends in container E.

premise: Stream C directly hits the red bar (central).
conclusion: The red bar slides stream C a good way rightward.

premise: Stream C slides rightward and falls past the blue mouth, striking the little yellow funnel bar.
conclusion: The yellow funnel guides stream C into the yellow well.

premise: Stream C flows into the yellow well.
conclusion: Stream C ends in container F.

premise: Stream D meets the thin purple bar (top-right).
conclusion: The purple bar sends stream D down-and-left.

premise: Stream D flows down-and-left and falls to the pink bar, then to the same yellow funnel.
conclusion: The yellow funnel guides stream D into the yellow well.

premise: Stream D flows into the yellow well.
conclusion: Stream D ends in container F.

premise: Streams A and B flow into container E, and streams C and D flow into container F.
conclusion: The mixture of A, B, and C separates into container E and F equally; stream D ends in container F.
